title: Anti-agers no one but you need to know about
text:
Q: I’m 61 and have very limited funds. Is there anything out there that can help me tackle my sagging jowls and restore my once smooth jawline?

A: I’m not going to lie: only a facelift can get rid of jowls. Expensive non-invasive treatments can improve them markedly but not make them vanish.

The cheapest thing you can do is commit to using a facial tool that will drain lymph fluids and stimulate nutrient flow —this will cause mild temporary tightening and, over time, stronger, plumper skin with more definition.

A 61-year-old reader asked how to best treat their sagging jowls and restore a smoother jawline (file image)

Compare it to daily body-brushing, which is the best self-treatment for better-toned body skin with less cellulite.

The Jillian Dempsey Gold Sculpting Bar (£185, cultbeauty.co.uk) is a handheld, fast-vibrating metal bar that you stroke along parts of the face for a visible lift and glow.

The NuFace Mini Facial Toning Device (£167, currentbody.com) emits microcurrents to tighten facial muscles for an (often very quick, though temporary) lifted effect.

Both are actually very pleasant to use and a bit addictive, which is just what you need to get you using them each and every day to see long-term results!

It’s not a miracle cure but a worth-it investment in better skin and some lovely self-care.

Beauty director Inge van Lotringen (pictured) advised the reader to use a facial tool that will drain lymph fluids and stimulate nutrient flow

Ingeborg van Lotringen is beauty director at Cosmopolitan. Email questions to inge@dailymail.co.uk
